text: Hi, is there some kind of community repository for chaincodes / applications? I’d like to run examples beyond what’s provided in [<https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/tree/master/examples>]. Thanks!

<@U1NSNCVBN> Like what <@U2AS0GVSP> mentioned, I’ve seen that problem as well when querying too early. Increasing the sleep time between deploy and query should solve the problem (assuming everything else is set up and deployed properly).

<@U196R0LA2>  - if you have some ideas on starting something up, that would be great.  we did a couple examples from an IBM perspective but we've been looking for a community home as well.  We have a few of our apps and chaincodes at <https://github.com/IBM-Blockchain>

attachments.title: IBM Blockchain
attachments.text: GitHub is where people build software. More than 18 million people use GitHub to discover, fork, and contribute to over 47 million projects.

text: <@U196R0LA2> I am running the asset management with roles example straight from Github, it comes with its own unit tests and I didn't change anything. So it shouldn't have been a problem
<@U1NSNCVBN> My first thoughts are that the sleep values set in that test are insufficient for you cluster size or CPU resources
<@U0PB67X4K> Thanks for those resources!
<@U303ZCX7S|liuhaidl> has joined the channel

How could I integrate customized CA into fabric??
<@U319G36P4|chris.zhenghf> has joined the channel
Hy All, As we know once we enrolled a user to CA and its token created after that we can't use same credentials it will give error of "Error: identity or token do not match"
So, my question is that how can i reuse the token from client side using java sdk

Hi, I’m attempting to split the asset management demo [<https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/tree/master/examples/chaincode/go/asset_management>] into separate applications, one for each step: deployment, ownership assignment, and ownership transfer.

The first application runs fine, but the second one fails — I’ve figured out that it’s because I need to generate another TCert for the “bob” user, but it's not the same as the one generated in the first application, performed here: [<https://github.com/mikezaccardo/fabric/commit/a7471d8ecb873533fa82233fab7f9c167ce26820#diff-6ae780dac4abd9e4c1e7f0530474b734R55>].

Is there an elegant way around this problem? Should I serialize the TCert that is created in the first application? Or perhaps I’m not undestanding the cert model properly. Thanks for any help!
<@U196R0LA2|mikezaccardo> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/mikezaccardo/F31A26L8J/app2_failure_out.txt|app2_failure.out>
